pr_title: HMS device_type detection and HMS token registration

timeline.bodyText: Should we include a range here or keep it specific for now?
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Since this is compileOnly let's not use a version range here so builds are consistent.
replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
Convert ShowUpdateGPSDialog to lowercase first letter?
showUpdateGPSDialog
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: 👍 Good catch, might as well clean this up while in here
replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.author: Jeasmine
jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
Just an overall comment for these UnitTests, maybe we should offer some steps explaining what each line truly means or create more specific test names.
This one is a good example and offers clarity
supportsFCMAndADM_PreferADM
but even could be testDevice_withFCMAndADMSupport_prefersADM
however, this one
supportedHMS_isHuawei
could be
testDevice_withHMSSupport_prefersHMS
I'm probably being to critical though since it only took me a few seconds to figure out the pattern here. I guess this could stay the same since I recognized the consistent pattern, but wanted to bring it up to see what you thought.
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText:
Adding testDevice_ seems reducend if prefixing each test with it.
The pattern I was going for was state_expectedResult.
I agree that we should narrow down a naming pattern, since the scope of this problem is limited to HMS only lets defer
replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
Should we throw these Assert helpers inside another class like JsonAsserts and RestClientAsserts
maybe DeviceTypeAsserts?
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: do you need to sleep the thread? cant this be runnable with post delay?
timeline.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText: This sleep is running on it's own thread created from the registerForPush above. What are the benefits of using postDelayed? Since this is it's own thread we would also need to start a looper is why I am asking.
replies.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText: I was worried if the thread was being shared, but is it all runs in the same thread I suppose there is no harm. The postDelay was to not leave a thread without doing nothing.
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.message:
HMS device_type detection and value

* Added Huawei as device_type 13
* Added detecting if HMS exists and only use it if
Google play servcies is not on the device and is not enabled.

timeline.bodyText: You can use the new utils function
timeline.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText: oh I think the new util function is in the other PR 😢

replies.bodyText: Added to this one, since it is a better fit anyway
